newsitem.title: GUATEMALA: Nine dead, 36 injured in Guatemala land dispute.
newsitem.headline: Nine dead, 36 injured in Guatemala land dispute.

text.p: Nine people died and 36 were injured on Sunday and Monday in fighting over a decades-old land dispute in western Guatemala, emergency workers said on Monday.
"The autopsies are being done right in the marketplace," Abelardo Diaz of the volunteer rescue squad in Quetzaltenango told Reuters.

The battle was sparked by a long-running dispute over land near this village that is claimed by residents of two separate provinces. San Juan is about 100 miles 160 km west of Guatemala City, the capital.
Some 500 residents carrying firearms, machetes and other weapons continued to occupy the village of San Juan de Argueta on Monday afternoon, limiting access to emergency and security personnel.
Only rescue vehicles, some of them carrying police or government officials, were permitted to enter and leave, he said.
From Sunday night to Monday morning rescue officials transported the injured to nearby hospitals with bullet wounds, burns from explosives and wounds from machetes and sticks, he said.
